Posted: February 5
												Synopsis Born in Austria in 1889, Adolf Hitler rose to power in German politics as leader of the National Socialist German Workers Party, also known as the Nazi Party. Hitler was chancellor of Germany from 1933 to 1945, and served as dictator from 1934 to 1945. His policies precipitated World War II and the Holocaust. Hitler committed suicide with wife Eva Braun on April 30, 1945, in his Berlin bunker. Early Years Dictator Adolf Hitler was born in Braunau am Inn, Austria, on April 20, 1889, and was the fourth of six children born to Alois Hitler and Klara Polzl. When Hitler was 3 years old, the family moved from Austria to Germany. As a child, Hitler clashed frequently with his father. Following the death of his younger brother, Edmund, in 1900, he became detached and introverted. His father did not approve of his interest in fine art rather than business. In addition to art, Hitler showed an early interest in German nationalism, rejecting the authority of Austria-Hungary. This nationalism would become the motivating force of Hitler's life. Alois died suddenly in 1903. Two years later, Adolf's mother allowed her son to drop out of school. He moved to Vienna and worked as a casual laborer and a watercolor painter. Hitler applied to the Academy of Fine Arts twice, and was rejected both times. Out of money, he moved into a homeless shelter, where he remained for several years. Hitler later pointed to these years as the time when he first cultivated his anti-Semitism, though there is some debate about this account. At the outbreak of World War I, Hitler applied to serve in the German army. He was accepted in August 1914, though he was still an Austrian citizen. Although he spent much of his time away from the front lines, Hitler was present at a number of significant battles and was wounded at the Somme. He was decorated for bravery, receiving the Iron Cross First Class and the Black Wound Badge. 3 GALLERY 3 Images Hitler became embittered over the collapse of the war effort. The experience reinforced his passionate German patriotism, and he was shocked by Germany's surrender in 1918. Like other German nationalists, he believed that the German army had been betrayed by civilian leaders and Marxists. He found the Treaty of Versailles degrading, particularly the demilitarization of the Rhineland and the stipulation that Germany accept responsibility for starting the war. After World War I, Hitler returned to Munich and continued to work for the military as an intelligence officer. While monitoring the activities of the German Workers’ Party (DAP), Hitler adopted many of the anti-Semitic, nationalist and anti-Marxist ideas of DAP founder Anton Drexler. Drexler invited Hitler to join the DAP, which he did in 1919. To increase its appeal, the DAP changed its name to the Nationalsozialistische Deutsche Arbeiterpartei (NSDAP). Hitler personally designed the party banner, featuring a swastika in a white circle on a red background. Hitler soon gained notoriety for his vitriolic speeches against the Treaty of Versailles, rival politicians, Marxists and Jews. In 1921, Hitler replaced Drexler as NSDAP party chairman. Hitler's vitriolic beer-hall speeches began attracting regular audiences. Early followers included army captain Ernst Rohm, the head of the Nazi paramilitary organization, the Sturmabteilung (SA), which protected meetings and frequently attacked political opponents. On November 8, 1923, Hitler and the SA stormed a public meeting of 3,000 people at a large beer hall in Munich. Hitler announced that the national revolution had begun and declared the formation of a new government. After a short struggle including 20 deaths, the coup, known as the "Beer Hall Putsch," failed. Hitler was arrested three days later and tried for high treason. He served a year in prison, during which time he dictated most of the first volume of Mein Kampf ("My Struggle") to his deputy, Rudolf Hess. The book laid out Hitler's plans for transforming German society into one based on race. Rise to Power The Great Depression in Germany provided a political opportunity for Hitler. Germans were ambivalent to the parliamentary republic and increasingly open to extremist options. In 1932, Hitler ran against Paul von Hindenburg for the presidency. Hitler came in second in both rounds of the election, garnering more than 35 percent of the vote in the final election. The election established Hitler as a strong force in German politics. Hindenburg reluctantly agreed to appoint Hitler as chancellor in order to promote political balance. Hitler used his position as chancellor to form a de facto legal dictatorship. The Reichstag Fire Decree, announced after a suspicious fire at the Reichstag, suspended basic rights and allowed detention without trial. Hitler also engineered the passage of the Enabling Act, which gave his cabinet full legislative powers for a period of four years and allowed deviations from the constitution. Having achieved full control over the legislative and executive branches of government, Hitler and his political allies embarked on a systematic suppression of the remaining political opposition. By the end of June, the other parties had been intimidated into disbanding. On July 14, 1933, Hitler's Nazi Party was declared the only legal political party in Germany. Military opposition was also punished. The demands of the SA for more political and military power led to the Night of the Long Knives, which took place from June 30 to July 2, 1934. Ernst Röhm and other SA leaders, along with a number of Hitler's political enemies, were rounded up and shot. The day before Hindenburg's death in August 1934, the cabinet had enacted a law abolishing the office of president and combining its powers with those of the chancellor. Hitler thus became head of state as well as head of government, and was formally named as leader and chancellor. As head of state, Hitler became supreme commander of the armed forces. He began to mobilize for war. Germany withdrew from the League of Nations, and Hitler announced a massive expansion of Germany’s armed forces. The Nazi regime also included social reform measures. Hitler promoted anti-smoking campaigns across the country. These campaigns stemmed from Hitler's self-imposed dietary restrictions, which included abstinence from alcohol and meat. At dinners, Hitler sometimes told graphic stories about the slaughter of animals in an effort to shame his fellow diners. He encouraged all Germans to keep their bodies pure of any intoxicating or unclean substance. A main Nazi concept was the notion of racial hygiene. New laws banned marriage between non-Jewish and Jewish Germans, and deprived "non-Aryans" of the benefits of German citizenship. Hitler's early eugenic policies targeted children with physical and developmental disabilities, and later authorized a euthanasia program for disabled adults. The Holocaust was also conducted under the auspices of racial hygiene. Between 1939 and 1945, Nazis and their collaborators were responsible for the deaths of 11 million to 14 million people, including about 6 million Jews, representing two-thirds of the Jewish population in Europe. Deaths took place in concentration and extermination camps and through mass executions. Other persecuted groups included Poles, communists, homosexuals, Jehovah's Witnesses and trade unionists, among others. Hitler probably never visited the concentration camps and did not speak publicly about the killings. World War II In 1938Hitler, along with several other European leaders, signed the Munich Agreement. The treaty ceded the Sudetenland districts to Germany, reversing part of the Versailles Treaty. As a result of the summit, Hitler was named Time magazine's Man of the Year for 1938. This diplomatic win only whetted his appetite for a renewed German dominance. On September 1, Germany invaded Poland. In response, Britain and France declared war on Germany

Hitler later pointed to these years as the time when he first cultivated his anti-Semitism, though there is some debate about this account. Although he spent much of his time away from the front lines, Hitler was present at a number of significant battles and was wounded at the Somme. He was decorated for bravery, receiving the Iron Cross First Class and the Black Wound Badge. 3 GALLERY 3 Images Hitler became embittered over the collapse of the war effort. The experience reinforced his passionate German patriotism, and he was shocked by Germany's surrender in 1918. Like other German nationalists, he believed that the German army had been betrayed by civilian leaders and Marxists. He found the Treaty of Versailles degrading, particularly the demilitarization of the Rhineland and the stipulation that Germany accept responsibility for starting the war. After World War I, Hitler returned to Munich and continued to work for the military as an intelligence officer. While monitoring the activities of the German Workers’ Party (DAP), Hitler adopted many of the anti-Semitic, nationalist and anti-Marxist ideas of DAP founder Anton Drexler. Drexler invited Hitler to join the DAP, which he did in 1919. To increase its appeal, the DAP changed its name to the Nationalsozialistische Deutsche Arbeiterpartei (NSDAP). Hitler personally designed the party banner, featuring a swastika in a white circle on a red background. Hitler soon gained notoriety for his vitriolic speeches against the Treaty of Versailles, rival politicians, Marxists and Jews. In 1921, Hitler replaced Drexler as NSDAP party chairman. Hitler's vitriolic beer-hall speeches began attracting regular audiences. Early followers included army captain Ernst Rohm, the head of the Nazi paramilitary organization, the Sturmabteilung (SA), which protected meetings and frequently attacked political opponents. On November 8, 1923, Hitler and the SA stormed a public meeting of 3,000 people at a large beer hall in Munich. Hitler announced that the national revolution had begun and declared the formation of a new government. After a short struggle including 20 deaths, the coup, known as the "Beer Hall Putsch," failed. Hitler was arrested three days later and tried for high treason. He served a year in prison, during which time he dictated most of the first volume of Mein Kampf ("My Struggle") to his deputy, Rudolf Hess. The book laid out Hitler's plans for transforming German society into one based on race. Rise to Power The Great Depression in Germany provided a political opportunity for Hitler. Germans were ambivalent to the parliamentary republic and increasingly open to extremist options. In 1932, Hitler ran against Paul von Hindenburg for the presidency. Hitler came in second in both rounds of the election, garnering more than 35 percent of the vote in the final election. The election established Hitler as a strong force in German politics. Hindenburg reluctantly agreed to appoint Hitler as chancellor in order to promote political balance. Hitler used his position as chancellor to form a de facto legal dictatorship. The Reichstag Fire Decree, announced after a suspicious fire at the Reichstag, suspended basic rights and allowed detention without trial. Hitler also engineered the passage of the Enabling Act, which gave his cabinet full legislative powers for a period of four years and allowed deviations from the constitution. Having achieved full control over the legislative and executive branches of government, Hitler and his political allies embarked on a systematic suppression of the remaining political opposition. By the end of June, the other parties had been intimidated into disbanding. On July 14, 1933, Hitler's Nazi Party was declared the only legal political party in Germany. Military opposition was also punished. The demands of the SA for more political and military power led to the Night of the Long Knives, which took place from June 30 to July 2, 1934. Ernst Röhm and other SA leaders, along with a number of Hitler's political enemies, were rounded up and shot. The day before Hindenburg's death in August 1934, the cabinet had enacted a law abolishing the office of president and combining its powers with those of the chancellor. Hitler thus became head of state as well as head of government, and was formally named as leader and chancellor. As head of state, Hitler became supreme commander of the armed forces. Hitler promoted anti-smoking campaigns across the country. These campaigns stemmed from Hitler's self-imposed dietary restrictions, which included abstinence from alcohol and meat. At dinners, Hitler sometimes told graphic stories about the slaughter of animals in an effort to shame his fellow diners. He encouraged all Germans to keep their bodies pure of any intoxicating or unclean substance. A main Nazi concept was the notion of racial hygiene. New laws banned marriage between non-Jewish and Jewish Germans, and deprived "non-Aryans" of the benefits of German citizenship. Hitler's early eugenic policies targeted children with physical and developmental disabilities, and later authorized a euthanasia program for disabled adults. The Holocaust was also conducted under the auspices of racial hygiene. Between 1939 and 1945, Nazis and their collaborators were responsible for the deaths of 11 million to 14 million people, including about 6 million Jews, representing two-thirds of the Jewish population in Europe. Deaths took place in concentration and extermination camps and through mass executions. Other persecuted groups included Poles, communists, homosexuals, Jehovah's Witnesses and trade unionists, among others. Hitler probably never visited the concentration camps and did not speak publicly about the killings. As a result of the summit, Hitler was named Time magazine's Man of the Year for 1938. This diplomatic win only whetted his appetite for a renewed German dominance. On September 1, Germany invaded Poland. In response, Britain and France declared war on Germany

Hitler was chancellor of Germany from 1933 to 1945, and served as dictator from 1934 to 1945. His policies precipitated World War II and the Holocaust. Hitler committed suicide with wife Eva Braun on April 30, 1945, in his Berlin bunker. content:
Posted: December 28, 2016
Apollo PotatoLet me start off by saying.... this is not a John Madden meme review like 99% of the others. This is a legitimate, comprehensive & In-depth analysis of the games content and features.Yes, there is a text to speech feature & yes it is hilarious beyond measure & fun for the whole family but we are here to provide you with an informative review designed to help you with your decision as to whether or not this game is worth your valuable time SO STAY ON TRACK!!! Short Answer: Yes. Yes it is.Long Answer: You have 25 minutes to restore oxygen to a Moon base that was hit by a meteor shower. There are 4 maps designed for either 1-2 players, 3-4 players, 5-6 players and one that has 2 different bases which appears to be set at night which is also kind of spooky. This game is pretty much dead so you’re best playing this with friends. I played with 1 other and we beat both the 1-2 player mode and 3-4 player mode after we figured out what we were doing and SOMEONE stopped messing around the with text to speech while we casually ran out of oxygen. The Idea is you have to repair different things that provide oxygen to your base. Some areas require you to use a robot due to coolant leaks or something that causes death if you say "fook it yolo" and just go in dry. Pretty much it’s a race against the clock to get oxygen running to the base with enough (OH)2 pre second to beat the countdown clock. During our playtime we encountered 1 bug that related to trying to place down or wrench a cable together to close to one of the ramps that you use for getting the robots over which we managed to fix by driving the landrover into the player enough to push him out of the way. 9.3/10- Houston we have 25 minutes of oxygen left & my wrench has floated away....Houston: Copy your last that. We can have someone out there is 3 months, Over.

Posted: January 16, 2015
												Moonbase Alpha is an incredibly addicting and fun game. It has just the right amount of story elements combined with multiplayer and cooperation missions that make it so fun. There is also a text to speech chat feature that is pretty fun to mess around with. You could play for hours on this game! And the best part is, it's free! So if you don't like it, you can always uninstall it with nothing to loose (which is highly unlikely considering how fun the game is). In general, Moonbase Alpha is a GREAT game and I highly recommend it to anyone into the space simulation genre.9.5/10

Posted: February 15, 2016
												This game ♥♥♥♥s with head! i just got this game for the text to speach as probably 90% of the community has, but I reasently have been questioning what this game is realy about. I was messing around one day when my friend freaked the ♥♥♥♥ out, he said he saw in the corner of his eye a old man with no space suit on that dissapeared as quick as he appeared. Now what weird about this is that no one else was on the server. So I was of corse sceptical and told him he was seeing things. I was curious though and started to look around more, then while i didnt expect it I saw a man in a space suit fly at me realy fast with his arms out and disapeared. this realy scared me. So we when off exploring and started seeing more and more weird♥♥♥♥♥♥ we even herd and saw a little girl with no suit. I sware we arnt going crazy, my freind recored his screen arter a little while and caught some of the things happening. I dont know if this is supposed to be in the game becuase im very new but I looked this stuff up and found noting. If anyone knows anything about whats going on pls tell.I think this game is ok but i dont know if this is supposed to be a horror game. cuz i think it is with all of the jump scares.

content:
Posted: October 13, 2015
												Have you ever wondered what it's like to be ear♥♥♥♥♥♥♥on the moon? Well, you can do that.Have you ever wanted to listen to "John Madden" and "Dank Memes" coming from a text-to-speech program? In this game, you can.Are you a broke pleb who can't afford Space Engineers? Too bad, this game isn't for you.Ever wanted to accidentally start supporting a free pro-pedophile campaign? No? Well in this game, you'll often find yourself doing that.Ever wanted to experience what it's like to live on the moon and repair a moon base? Tough sh*t, you won't do anything other than sit around and use the TTS, sometimes you won't even move from spawn.

number of helpful: 3 of 7 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 2
												Hello Fellow Astronauts,I can not recommend Moonbase Alpha, period. End of story. The objectives are ill-defined and I really had no idea what I was doing at first, but even when I did start to understand what the objectives were and how to go about them, I still got incredibly bored extremely quickly. The community kind of sucks, nobody is really helpful and people just like to abuse the terrible voice emulator from what they type. The only fun thing out of this game is the voice that is used once something is typed, and it's only sort of amusing because it's so bad. The mechanics in the games feel a little slow, but I thought they did a good job mimicking the gravity. Overall, this game is completely miserable, and I can't recommend it in good knowledge. You're welcome to try it because it's free, but the community is kind of dead, there aren't a whole lot of people who play it. Definitely not worth wasting the computer space.-Kyle James

content:
Posted: December 27, 2015
An out of this world experience - 9/10This game transcends what we mean by a game. It's a piece of modern art (modern game?). If you're trying to find the art (game) in it, you're doing it all wrong. This game with it's breathtaking text-to-speech engine and high-jumping is meant to be experienced in the short time you're alive until your oxygen reserve depletes and you die side by side with your fellow astronauts.Pros:+ Futuristic Text-to-speech chatroom + John Madden+ yyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyypenisyyyyyyyyyyaaaaeiiiioooouubaginauuuuuuuuuaaaaaaaaaayyyCons:- Could've added Team Deathmatch Will wait for Moonbase Beta

content:
Posted: May 27, 2015
												NASA definitely put a lot of hard work into this game, it's reasonably realistic if played on competitive mode yet still playable by those who have no knowledge of oxygen circulation systems.And of course there's the text-to-speech, even the most serious of statements such as "We are doomed." or "Commence self destruct." sound absolutely hilarious. Obviously you can't have the text-to-speech without feeling the uncontrollable urge to babble unintelligibly into the chat just to see what it will pronounce and utter completely meaningless phrases repeatedly until they annoy you and everyone around you.All in all this is a great game to play with friends, although I wouldn't recommend going on a public server unless you are not worried about permanent mental scarring.aeiou

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 19, 2015
												For me it's not a game. It's more like time challenge. Had fun with my friend for like 45 mins. It could have more gamemodes, but i think it's cool. I haven't seen any bugs but only our rover got stuck on rock.Now time for some pros and cons:------------------------------------------------------------------------PROS:✔ Good physic engine✔ Good optimization✔ Rover energy is regenarating pretty quick✔ Not very hard, but not too easy quick-time-events✔ Well laid out interface------------------------------------------------------------------------CONS:✘ Too slow movement✘ Weird and slow animations✘ Only one gamemode✘ Not very good graphics (I played on High)✘ Weird white objects on skybox/horizon✘ Annoying lector that quielty says none-senses in background------------------------------------------------------------------------I don't want to hate this game much, but it could be better. I really want to see this game in final version. :)    I recommend to someone that is bored and want to play a free game fast ;)

content:
Posted: March 1, 2015
												welcome to my review on moonbase alphathis game i have on played fr half hour to see what single player was like so i wanna say i dont know anything about any story to this gamei have messed about on free play wich is like open world spacethis game can get technical but who cares its a space gameu can do the normal stuff a typical space game doesi love just going round jumping in the anti-gravity and driving and fixing up stuff but it gets a bit boring on your own.the online could be fun not sure but its really funny to switch to first person and look down with a tool in ur hand and realise u have no arms or legsi really think this game has alot of potential because its the only game ive ever played where u can open world in space. Did i mention this is by N.A.S.A so it will have alot of spacey technical stuff.i think the graphics are decnt so if u have a high end PC it will have great graphics like whenever something touches moons dust it leaves a mark and its really funny.overall i like this game and really think it has allot of potential. now im going to give proes and cons nowPROS-very fun-great graphics-nice to play-relaxing-good onlineCONS-gets a bit boring afetr a whileoverall this game is very funthe graphics- 8-10gameplay-9-10overall-9.4-10thanks for reading please like and PEACE :D
